original_definition: 'Voltage Regulation Distribution Transformer' means a medium power transformer equipped with additional components, inside or outside of the transformer tank, to automatically control the input or output voltage of the transformer for on-load voltage regulation purposes.
generated_definition: 'Voltage Regulation Distribution Transformer' means voltage regulation distribution transformers are medium power transformers with rated power ≤ 3 150 kva equipped with tapping connections suitable for operation while being energised or on-load for voltage adaptation purposes.

Article 2: ‘Voltage Regulation Distribution Transformer’ means a medium power transformer equipped with additional components, inside or outside of the transformer tank, to automatically control the input or output voltage of the transformer for on-load voltage regulation purposes.
Article 8: 1.3.   Requirements for medium power transformers with rated power ≤ 3 150 kVA equipped with tapping connections suitable for operation while being energised or on-load for voltage adaptation purposes. Voltage Regulation Distribution Transformers are included in this category.
